shanghai.tagline: Where East meets West at full speed.
shanghai.description: Neon-lit skyline meets century-old shikumen lanes. You'll sip cocktails in Art Deco jazz bars, then lose yourself in avant-garde galleries and Michelin-starred restaurants. Shanghai rewards those who want it all — and fast.
shanghai.matchReason: You and Shanghai are both restless, cosmopolitan, and impossible to box in. Shanghai's relentless fusion of East and West, its world-class dining scene, its neon-lit pace — all mirror your desire to experience everything life has on offer. Like the city itself, you thrive where ambition is the norm and standing still simply isn't an option.
shanghai.name: Shanghai
shanghai.label: The Cosmopolitan

beijing.description: Five thousand years of empire stare back at you from every corner. You'll stand where emperors once walked, cycle along the ancient hutong alleys, and feel the weight of history in every stone. This is China at its most monumental.
beijing.matchReason: You and Beijing share a gravitational pull toward depth, grandeur, and meaning. You're drawn to places where every street carries a story, every stone is weighted with history, and the scale of human achievement leaves you speechless. In the shadow of the Forbidden City, along ancient hutong lanes, Beijing speaks directly to the part of you that finds the modern world a little too shallow.
beijing.name: Beijing
beijing.label: The Imperial

xian.description: Still inside the world's best-preserved ancient city walls. You'll stand face-to-face with 8,000 terracotta warriors, feast in the Muslim Quarter night market, and feel the Silk Road pulse beneath your feet.
xian.matchReason: You and Xi'an are both rooted — fascinated by origins, drawn to places where civilization ran deepest. The Terracotta Army's silent ranks, the ancient city walls, the Muslim Quarter's living traditions — Xi'an speaks to the part of you that wants to understand not just where the world is, but how it got here.
xian.name: Xi'an
xian.label: The Ancient

chengdu.tagline: Where life moves at the perfect pace.
chengdu.description: Pandas, hot pot, and zero urgency — Chengdu operates on its own time. You'll spend mornings at the panda sanctuary, afternoons in a teahouse watching the world go by, and evenings melting into a spicy communal hot pot.
chengdu.matchReason: You and Chengdu operate on the same wavelength: unhurried, warm, and deeply pleasurable. You believe life is meant to be savored, not rushed. Chengdu won't ask you to optimize your itinerary or squeeze in one more attraction. It will ask you to stay a little longer in the teahouse, order another round of hot pot, and be exactly where you are.
chengdu.name: Chengdu
chengdu.label: The Unbothered

guilin.description: Every view here looks like a classical ink painting come to life. You'll cruise the Li River between surreal karst peaks, bicycle through terraced rice fields, and wake up to mist rising over the mountains.
guilin.matchReason: You and Guilin are dreamers at heart. Where others see terrain, you see a painting. The karst peaks rising over the Li River, the mist-draped rice terraces, the still water reflecting impossible mountains — Guilin is for those who still believe the natural world has the power to stop you completely in your tracks.
guilin.name: Guilin
guilin.label: The Dreamscape

dali.tagline: Where free spirits find their people.
dali.description: Dali is where travelers who never quite fit in, fit right in. You'll wander marble alleys lined with indie cafés, watch local Bai ceremonies, and swim in the turquoise Erhai Lake with snow-capped mountains on the horizon.
dali.matchReason: You and Dali both value freedom over convention and authenticity over polish. This is a city for people who have quietly opted out of the mainstream — and found something better. Dali's Erhai Lake, its Bai minority culture, its unhurried indie café scene speak to someone who needs their surroundings to have a soul.
dali.name: Dali
dali.label: The Free Spirit

xiamen.tagline: Where coastal charm meets easy living.
xiamen.description: Piano Island, bougainvillea-draped colonial lanes, the best seafood you've ever had. You'll stroll the car-free Gulangyu island, photograph pastel European architecture, and end the day watching the sunset over the strait.
xiamen.matchReason: You and Xiamen share a certain ease and romance with the world. You're someone who finds joy in the texture of everyday life — ocean breezes, unhurried meals, streets that feel genuinely lived-in and lovely. Gulangyu's colonial charm, the seafood, the slow afternoons — Xiamen is for those who have learned to appreciate the quiet things.
xiamen.name: Xiamen
xiamen.label: The Coastal Charmer

zhangjiajie.description: The real-life floating mountains that inspired Avatar. You'll hike through cloud-wrapped sandstone pillars, cross the world's longest glass bridge, and feel genuinely awe-struck by a landscape that shouldn't be possible.
zhangjiajie.matchReason: You and Zhangjiajie both refuse to be ordinary. You're drawn to experiences that defy expectation — landscapes that make the jaw drop and the brain stall. The Avatar-inspiring sandstone pillars, the glass bridge over the clouds, the geological improbability of it all — this is a destination for those who want nature to humble them completely.
zhangjiajie.name: Zhangjiajie
zhangjiajie.label: The Avatar Mountains

harbin.description: Every January, Harbin builds a city out of ice — and it's exactly as unreal as it sounds. You'll walk through illuminated ice castles the size of buildings, eat Russian-influenced food in onion-domed architecture, and embrace the minus-20 cold as part of the adventure.
harbin.matchReason: You and Harbin both lean into the extreme. Where others retreat from cold and darkness, you find adventure and wonder. Harbin's ice festival, its Russian-influenced architecture, its embrace of the brutal winter — all speak to a traveler who collects experiences that most people would never attempt.
harbin.name: Harbin
harbin.label: The Ice Kingdom

hangzhou.description: West Lake at dawn, green tea fields in the hills, thousand-year-old temples reflected in still water. You'll cycle around the lake, sip Dragon Well tea at its source, and understand why the ancient Chinese called this place heaven on earth.
hangzhou.matchReason: You and Hangzhou are both drawn to beauty that has stood the test of time. You find meaning in elegance, quiet mornings, and landscapes that have moved poets for a thousand years. West Lake, Dragon Well tea at its source, ancient temples wrapped in mist — Hangzhou is for someone who understands that some places deserve to be understood slowly.
hangzhou.name: Hangzhou
hangzhou.label: The Serene Classic

chongqing.tagline: Where cities defy the laws of physics.
chongqing.description: Chongqing exists in three dimensions — literally. You'll exit a subway into the 20th floor of a building, watch skyscrapers emerge from morning fog like a cyberpunk dream, and eat the most numbing, most addictive hot pot on the planet.
chongqing.matchReason: You and Chongqing are both unapologetically intense. The city stacks itself into the hills, defies urban logic, and hits you with flavors that are genuinely hard to describe. You're someone who responds to a place that has personality in every direction — vertically, horizontally, and in every bowl of mala hot pot.
chongqing.name: Chongqing
chongqing.label: The Cyberpunk City

shenzhen.tagline: Where the future is already here.
shenzhen.description: China's fastest city grew from farmland to megacity in 30 years, and it shows. You'll explore cutting-edge tech museums, wander the world's most creative urbanism, and feel the electric energy of a place still inventing itself.
shenzhen.matchReason: You and Shenzhen are both oriented toward what comes next. This is a city that skipped the past and went straight to the future — and you find that thrilling, not unsettling. Tech parks, creative districts, a skyline still evolving: Shenzhen is built for people who think in possibilities rather than certainties.
shenzhen.name: Shenzhen
shenzhen.label: The Future City

sanya.tagline: Where China surprises you with paradise.
sanya.description: Clear turquoise water, powder-white sand, and no one expecting you to be anywhere. You'll swim in warm South China Sea bays, explore dramatic coastal rock formations at sunset, and discover that China has a proper tropical paradise most people don't know about.
sanya.matchReason: You and Sanya both know when to stop. The South China Sea's warmth, the powder-white beaches, the complete absence of urgency — Sanya is for travelers who understand that sometimes the best destination is one that asks nothing of you except to simply be present.
sanya.name: Sanya
sanya.label: The Tropical Escape

dunhuang.tagline: Where the Silk Road comes alive.
dunhuang.description: The last major oasis before the desert swallowed the ancient Silk Road. You'll ride camels over the singing sand dunes of Mingsha Mountain, watch the crescent moon lake shimmer in impossible isolation, and enter the Mogao Caves — 1,000-year-old Buddhist paintings that survived the desert intact.
dunhuang.matchReason: You and Dunhuang are both seekers — drawn to edges, to places where civilizations converged, to landscapes that feel ancient and alive at once. The singing sand dunes, the crescent moon oasis, the Mogao Caves' thousand-year-old murals — Dunhuang is for someone comfortable with solitude and hungry for the profound.
dunhuang.name: Dunhuang
dunhuang.label: The Desert Wonder

guangzhou.tagline: Where every meal is a celebration.
guangzhou.description: Dim sum for breakfast, char siu for lunch, and the best wonton noodles you've ever had for dinner. You'll push a trolley through century-old teahouses, wander the Shamian island colonial quarter, and realize Guangzhou's food culture is a way of life.
guangzhou.matchReason: You and Guangzhou share a deep appreciation for the pleasures of daily life. Dim sum is not just food here — it's a philosophy. The Cantonese table, the century-old teahouses, the warmth of everyday ritual — Guangzhou speaks to someone who understands that a culture is best tasted through its mornings, its meals, and its people.
guangzhou.name: Guangzhou
guangzhou.label: The Cantonese Table

kunming.description: Mild weather, flower markets, and laid-back streets make Kunming feel easy from day one. You'll wander around Dianchi Lake, day-trip to the surreal Stone Forest, and settle into a slower rhythm without sacrificing city convenience.
kunming.matchReason: You and Kunming share a preference for balance over extremes. The city's year-round gentle climate, lakeside pace, and easy access to Yunnan's natural diversity fit travelers who want depth without pressure. Kunming won't demand urgency from you — it rewards curiosity, consistency, and calm exploration.
kunming.name: Kunming
kunming.label: The Spring City

qingdao.tagline: Where sea breeze meets beer culture.
qingdao.description: German-era avenues, fresh seafood, and a coastline built for long walks. You'll climb Laoshan for ocean views, explore red-roofed neighborhoods, and discover why Qingdao's food-and-beer culture makes summer trips effortless.
qingdao.matchReason: You and Qingdao both value atmosphere. This city blends coastal openness, walkable neighborhoods, and a relaxed social scene that feels easy to join. Between the sea, seafood, and its famous brewing legacy, Qingdao matches travelers who want culture and comfort in the same frame.
qingdao.name: Qingdao
qingdao.label: The Seaside Brew

suzhou.description: Classical gardens, canal-side lanes, and refined Jiangnan aesthetics define Suzhou. You'll move between UNESCO-listed gardens and old-water-town textures, then end the day with a quieter, more contemplative city pace.
suzhou.matchReason: You and Suzhou are aligned in temperament: attentive, detail-oriented, and drawn to subtle beauty. Suzhou rewards patience — from garden composition to canal-side living rhythms. If you value culture that reveals itself gradually, this city will feel deeply right.
suzhou.name: Suzhou
suzhou.label: The Garden Classic

lijiang.tagline: Where old-town nights meet snow peaks.
lijiang.description: Stone alleys and mountain air make Lijiang feel cinematic. You'll explore Naxi heritage in the old town, wake up to views of Jade Dragon Snow Mountain, and choose between gentle wandering and highland excursions.
lijiang.matchReason: You and Lijiang both seek places with character and contrast. Here, nightlife in a preserved old town meets dramatic alpine scenery the next morning. Lijiang suits travelers who want emotional texture, not just a checklist — culture, altitude, and atmosphere in one trip.
lijiang.name: Lijiang
lijiang.label: The Old Town Escape

zhuhai.description: Zhuhai is clean, open, and made for low-stress travel. You'll cycle along Lovers' Road, enjoy island-facing sunsets, and treat the trip as a true reset rather than a checklist sprint.
zhuhai.matchReason: You and Zhuhai both favor ease over intensity. The city's coastal layout, lighter tempo, and practical urban comfort support travelers who want to recover energy while still staying engaged. Zhuhai is for people who define a good trip by how good it feels, not by how packed it is.
zhuhai.name: Zhuhai
zhuhai.label: The Leisure Coast

nanjing.tagline: Where history and campus vibes intersect.
nanjing.description: Nanjing blends imperial memory with tree-lined modern neighborhoods. You'll walk old city walls, visit major museums and memorial sites, then switch to bookshops and cafe streets shaped by a strong university culture.
nanjing.matchReason: You and Nanjing share intellectual curiosity and emotional range. The city moves from dynastic history to modern student energy without losing coherence. If you want a destination that is reflective by day and quietly lively by night, Nanjing fits naturally.
nanjing.name: Nanjing
nanjing.label: The Scholarly Capital

dalian.tagline: Where the north opens to the sea.
dalian.description: Wide boulevards and sea air give Dalian a calm northern-coast identity. You'll combine city squares, cliffside viewpoints, and seafood-heavy evenings, especially in the summer escape season.
dalian.matchReason: You and Dalian both prefer room to breathe. This is a city with maritime openness, manageable scale, and a practical rhythm that stays pleasant even in peak season. Dalian works well for travelers who want coastal views without tropical crowds.
dalian.name: Dalian
dalian.label: The Breezy Port

wuhan.tagline: Where three towns pulse as one.
wuhan.description: Built around the Yangtze and Han rivers, Wuhan moves with big-city momentum and everyday grit. You'll cross historic riverfront landmarks, taste iconic local breakfast culture, and experience a less curated but highly authentic urban China.
wuhan.matchReason: You and Wuhan both have range and resilience. The city's three-town structure, river geography, and grounded daily culture create a dynamic that feels real rather than performative. Wuhan suits travelers who want to experience the energy of a major Chinese city beyond postcard framing.
wuhan.name: Wuhan
wuhan.label: The River Metropolis

changsha.tagline: Where night markets never slow down.
changsha.description: Changsha is all flavor, late nights, and young energy. You'll eat your way through fiery Hunan dishes, bounce between riverfront districts after dark, and see why the city has become a favorite for domestic weekend trips.
changsha.matchReason: You and Changsha both thrive on immediacy and social energy. This city is direct, flavorful, and consistently alive at night. If your ideal trip includes street food, music, and a crowd that stays out late, Changsha will feel instantly compatible.
changsha.name: Changsha
changsha.label: The Nightlife Spice
